comments.text: Plenty of vehicles going to Casablanca and Rabat so best to have a sign for your destination. Not much space to pull over but doesn't seem to be a big issue.

Juste avant un pÃ©age, idÃ©al pour aller Ã  Casablanca. Pour arriver ici, le L38 depuis Bab Doukkala mâ€™a coÃ»tÃ© 7 dirhams. Il fallait juste traverser le rond-point et tendre le pouce, presque immÃ©diatement on mâ€™a amenÃ© Ã  Casa
Right before the peage is a great spot for going towards Casablanca. How are you going to get there, though if you're not as lucky as me?
Plenty of holidayers heading out to see the gorges. Didnâ€™t take long for a lovely German couple to give me a lift to Dades
Very good spot near a gas station, payed 10mad for a petit taxi to get me there from tabount, you can wait under a tree in shade
Good spot with good place to stop the car, after 10 min stop Italians for me, no sign, afternoon
Use the highway, not the national road. We were picked up by guy from Agadir and we were smoking hash with him all the way. In agadir we were so baked that we spend the day at the beach.
Right next roundabout. Hard gravel shoulder. You can choose previous exit to Agadir by national road but this one is much faster.

3 minutes, you read it well
Empty grand taxi hoing back to Tanger took me all the way there for free
Just say "no money"
It's a pretty long walk from the medina to this spot, but here you are sure any car is going out of town and north, got picked almost instantly by two nice men who took us to see Pont de Dieu.

Not a lot of traffic. But a lot of nice people. First part we were in a trunk of pick-up than we changed to car who spoke English. (Cars have to stop sometimes in the valley because the road is being reconstructed because of the earthquake 2023), and this guy then took us to hotel of his friend, so much better price

Guy with local bus took us aerly at the morning. We were riding on the roof with local workers. They are rebilding this whole road through the mountains. It was super slow but beautiful. If you want to go fast to the south use highway.
Cars, not that fast going uphill and just right amount of traffic. Perfect spot for going Atlas. We got picked up by young group who stopped for us to take pictures twice at the view spots.
Good spot to go in direction of asni
First car stoped
Picked up by an Ambulance off duty. With a sign in Arabic and French
Not much shade here on a sunny day but got a quick ride from some nice guys to the next town over early morning.

From this spot in front of the petrol station we found a lift after 15 minutes that took us straight to Assilah. Lot of traffic and room for the cars to pull over, and a roundabout to slow them down. Cons: far from the center.

to go to Teotuan you can go either left and right, the traffic comes from the cascades and i bet you can find a ride pretty easily, a couple gave us a ride to Oued Laou, no waiting. Once in the town-center of Oued Laou you can get a mini-bus to Tetouan for just 10 dh.
perfect spot to go north, we (2px) waited just for 5 minutes to get a ride to Kasba Tadla in the early morning.

Dropped here by this couple of truck drivers afraid of finding police, we (3px) started walking towards Aoulouz, got picked up after 10 minutes by this old man driving a very old wreck who took us to town. From there we bargained a bus ticket to Ouarzazate for just 50 dh each (4 hours drive).

If you find yourself stranded in the hell of Agadir, do one thing and only one, take bus 12 to Ait Melloul (4dh), ask to be dropped at this roundabout, perfect spot to go east, lot of traffic, and plenty of space to pull off for the cars, we (3px) got a ride after 15 minutes to Oulad Teima (from there you can eventually catch a red bus to Taroudant, which costs just 8 dh). If you don't make it out of the city, there is this bus 361 going to Oulad Dahou, out of town, stopping at this roundabout.

Perfect spot to go south to Agadir, just about 3 km from the medina center, many cars driving by, stand in front of a small parking lot, we (3 pax) got a free ride after 5 minutes by a nice taxi-driver who took us all the way to Tamanar.
Go to the street and put out your thumb.

Excelent point. After roundabout cars drive slow and there is plenty of space to stop. After 20 minutes directly to Casablanca. One minus is that, there is a lot of locals who seek for the ride to short distances.
great spot. took a little while to hitch there, but there is plenty of space to stop and it is easy to get a ride to meknes, rabat, maybe even casa.

There are two police checkpoints next to each other here in direction north. They are quite far to walk from the center of Laayoune but it is possibile and I saw a bus running there as well (I think it was number 3 and should cost around 2 Dirham, but better ask). The police didn't let me hitchhike because they thought it isn't save, but they quickly found a truck for me that was going all the way to Guelmim.
Just at the roundabout, got picked up by some guides returning from a tour. Good amount of traffic to get to Marrakesh
To Tanger. Everybody stops. We were two females, very fast getting a ride.

There is lots of traffic from the highway from Marrakech here. There is some space to stop and some local hitchhikers as well behind the roundabout. Direction south you can accept a ride to the airport and get out at the next intersection few minutes away.
Very good place to hitchhike to Tanger.
Very good place to hitchhike to Rabat.
Very good place to hitchhike to Tanger or Fes.
Peage after the airport. The '26' on the right side of the license plates are cars from Marrakech.
Perfect place to Casablanca direction.

How to get this place: take a bus number 18 from Bab Doukkala (out of medina). Bus ticket costs 3 dirham (0,3 euro). Destinatin bus stop name is Marjane. Cross the road (Route de Casablanca) and walk hundred of metres. Voila!
We hitchhiked from here to join Marrakech. After only 2 minutes, two germans took us to the capital !
Take the Bus NÂ°16 to the Airport and get off here before he goes straight. Nice Spot to get to the South.
There's no need to take a taxi. Take the Bus nÂ°9 from the Gare Routiere. Get off the Bus before he goes to the Airport and get your thumb out on the N1
I met some fellow travellers that proposed to me to get me to Casablanca. I wasn't even planning to go here but I agreed. Just start conversations if.
Police officers at the checkpoint helped me to get a lift
Good spot to get towards Agadir

Good spot if you going north 
It took me 5 min to find a car going directly to Tetouan
Local with porsche drove us to city center, However, I don't reccomend to go there, because then only taxi or other people who wants money stop.
After while an old scottish couple with caravan took us close to marrakesh, they stopped at markets twice to show us how to buy stuff cheaply, It was really good ride for beginning
First car took us to city center

Lots of place for a car to pull up. Judging from my previous experience and knowledge now my short wait was just luck. Abdul, a desert camp owner from Merzouga. He was registered to take tourists. We still got pulled over and asked for registrations three times adding an hour to our drive. Managed to just get my lift before sun set and Abdul let me stay at his desert camp. Book with Morocco Tours Now!!
Lotsa tourists on their way to the next tourist spot. Plenty of space for you to be seen and a car to pull over. Was going to Fes so definitely needed a sign for a big hitchhiking distance
Incredible spot if youâ€™re staying in Imsouane. All the holidayers are heading to either Essaouira or Taghazout
One ride agadir to casablanca , took a cheap taxi to the spot, totaly worth it
Good Spot to get out of Fez towards west.
Perfect to go to Meknes
Grat spot. Local surfer picked us. His english was perfect. But watch out for turist scams through all the coast.
Excelent spot, just a sign that says "Marrakech" and we have our ride in less than 15 min

Good spot to go to Tanger. Unfortunately I had to pay for ride but that's mostly because I was to tired to fight for free ride after spending night under a bridge and before that escaping guy who wanted to have a gay sex with me but if you have energy to try to get a free ride this spot is definitely good (Aldo I've marked that I used thumb I actually used Arabic form of it which is pointing at the road with my forefinger)
We got a ride in the back of the scooter with the trailer, was fun! We were offered some tea and pastries before we headed further from Marrakesh.

Waited here for 6 min
Someone from Belgium took me all the way to Marrakech
Good spot, easy to find cars to the south.
Good spot, but not a lot traffic. You have to be lucky, to find someone to the bigger street, that leeds south or north.

very only way to go to imlil 
a couple of tourists pickups us 
they were supposed to stop the village just before but they let us directly to imlil

Super Spot pour descendre vers bouarfa petit Ã  petit 
TrÃ¨s important de se mettre au maximum Ã  lâ€™abris des regards de la police afin dâ€™Ã©viter tout problÃ¨me aux locaux et Ã  vous bien sÃ»r

I have hitchhiked from here 3 times and have never waited longer than 5 minutes(even with multiple people).
Hitchhiking is so engrained in the culture here that it's almost weird to even contemplate taking a bus somewhere. My only advice is always announce that you don't want to pay before getting in as sometimes they will try and pretend they are a taxi service ðŸ’…
Vers good Spot, Lots of Cars, Low wating time
Local, no sign, afternoon
After 5 min French tourist stop for me
Best spot goin south. Probably doesnt matter where you stand as long as theres space to stop and its not in a turn.
Obvious, but thats your spot if youre going to chaouen
Waited 2 minutes for a ride to Tetouan. Ideal Spot.
took 20minutes from here to tetouan. We got here by a nice driver that took us from chefchaoen
Not surprisingly, it's super easy to pull over. That's where we caught one of the coolest rides we ever had in Morocco. (March 2024)
At 7:30 am, there are a lot of workers hitchhiking towards Hassilabied/Merzouga. At that time, catching a ride is a matter of literally a few minutes, or even seconds. (March 2024)
Good place to hitchhike towards tinghir
Good place to stop, we catch a bus to ifran that agreed to take us for free
A lot of place to stop, the best is to stand on the top of the hill
One of good spots to get out of Rabat toward Fez
Good place to get to Essouira. We got to a orange truck and drove with nice slow speed to see all the beautiful landscape on the way. Very humble and kind humans. As Moroccoans in general.
I've never caught a car that quickly! To Ouarzazate, no sign, Saturday 9am
It was the fourth passing car, no sign, Friday 9am.
Friday around 11am
Scored a ride to the border with trucker. No payment expected. Long wait, quite a few rejections
Ask a local to write destanation sign in arabic. You will be picked up very fast.
You get a ride quite easily here. Lot of shared taxis driving as well. You can ride with them, ask for a free ride or wait until a regular car arrives.
I litterally showed my thumb and the first truck stopped to pick me up. Direction Rabat / Casablanca. Perfect
From the highway stoped on the side took 3 people right to Marrakech
There's an ibis hotel that many cars turn into, as well as a bus stop that most of the locals stand around at. If you go up the road past the hotel turnoff, there's trees for shade.
Perfect place to Marrakesh direction.
To get this place use the bus number 59 from the Place des Nations Unies.  Bus stop called "Marjane Technopark".

I stood on the petrol station side for a while, thereâ€™s ample stopping space but people may have assumed I was going south. While not as visible and harder to stop on I got lucky and hailed a truck the moment I moved to the east side of the road
no problemo for fes
Easy to Casablanca
As soon as i got here it was relatively easy catchin a ride to casa. Heavy traffic (afternoon)
We have just finished our cartboard to Casablanca and instantly Marrocan man said that he can give us a lift to Casa
Picked up by local tour guide heading to Imlil. Thumb and sign in Arabic
Ask local people in Asni to write a sign of your destination in Arabic. You'll be picked up bij a car within a few minutes
Good place going to Imlil, had some problems with police on the way there though, they thought the driver was an illegal taxi driver because of us.
Lots of nice local interaction, however finally got a lift with Italian tourists driving to Zagora. Not many cars on the road. A sign in Arabic helps with translations.

A good spot to pull over. We hitchhiked here twice (in March 2024 and February 2023), and in both instances, we waited for about 45 minutes. The waiting time heavily depends on the time of day. It's one of the places in the desert region of Morocco where we waited the longest for a ride. Nevertheless, we had some of the most memorable hitchhiking experiences here in Morocco (with a film producer heading to a Netflix film set in the middle of nowhere and with a super lovely Moroccan couple headin

Many competitors and I've waited here the longest in my entire trip. Trucks usually go to the mine and wouldn't pick you up. Eventually a really nice guy picked me up and the ride to Zagora is very scenic where we stopped to enjoy the view and he invited me to his home twice to eat together!

Saturday 11am, no sign.
Asked people at the gas station and found a ride to Marrakech within 15min
Asked maybe less than 4 times. Found a young fun group of 3 who took me to Safi. They made me in love with life.
There is a petrol station so there are many people who go to Marrakesh from here
Learn some Darija. I thought this car full of lovely ladies said 12km. Much better to hitch here than from 2km up the road
it is easy to find a good long ride here,
Good spot but a lot of local cars too.

It took a while but it worked well, its a good spot because there is a car selling coffee so cars and trucks stop, I put 4 stars because was quite windy and the sand is kind off like desert to its a bit painful in the eyes
Very good spot nice area to stop the car, big traffic a lot of drivers smiling and waving to us
Nice spot, we catch a bus which took us to errachidia for free
Nice scenic route with lots of cars going to errachidia
There is lot of people that are geting taxi. Ewen when we used thumb (in morroco thumb means hitch-hiking and the index finger means taxi) the guy we stoped wanted 10 dirhams.

Good place if you want to go to Essaouria or other places alongside Atlantic coast..
I waited only 15-30min for ride to Essaouria and there where also few local guys waiting..
go hundered meters AFTER the taxi stop, worked a lot better there. I think people assumed we wanted a taxi
Just after the police checkpoint and roundabout in direction Fes. Not too much traffic, but with a sign took me only 15 minutes to get a direct lift.
Everything perfect here

Location is perfect. You can supply yourself and cars are passing by slowly. Expect other morrocean hitchhikers.

Best hitchhike ever ! 2 sec of wataing, AC Bus, kind people and free food ;)
You can get here with the Bus NÂ°22. There's a big Supermarket. Get off there. After the Roundabout people pass slowly so it's easy to hitchhike. There's even a gas station.
Hitchhiked to Moulay Idriss and Volubilis, swift ride
alternative road to get fes (very close) u can visit also countryside and holy places like moulay idriss
Juste aprÃ¨s le pÃ©age. 5 minutes pour aller Ã  Tanger Med, mais je pense que câ€™est encore plus facile si tu vas Ã  lâ€™ouest

A toll booth that takes you to the highway A4. There is not too much traffic but if you just keep walking towards the highway on-ramp someone stops for sure because there are no local \\"hitchhikers\\" and a foreigner here sticks out like a sore thumb.
Not much traffic but space to stop. Probably the best to go south from here
Good place to stay, easy to go in south, car can stop ðŸŒ¸

Took me over an hour to get picked up here on a weekend. I walked down the street for quite a while after here, trying to hitchhike whenever a car came (not so often). Finally someone took me to the roundabout down the road from where it was no problem to get to Fes.

Right around here is the official end of Chefchaouen. There's room to pull over, but traffic isn't too high so they can just stop on the road. The 2nd vehicle picked me up, couple of Germans.

You could probably hitch much earlier before this spot :)
it's very good spot to get hh to Tanger !!!

i'm Always Use that spot! it's easy to use hh to Rabat & Bouznika!! But Sometimes less traffic!! and i used to wait more than 2 hours to get ride !! plus lot's of cars and cargo truck going to north ' Tanger' ...
easy to get Rabat, motorway are less traffic but u will avoid annoying minibuws/taxi/illegal taxi drivers
local hitchhiker spot, go here!
Place is very good to stop, but because many local people also use hitchhiking as a taxi there's hard to get a ride for free, and cars usually go to next village. In the end we took a bus to midelt

Almost no traffic south. If youre coming from the north and try to go south (direction meknes) and you have the option of a ride into quezzane its probably better to take it and hitch outta there again then standing here. Still lucky after an hour

Lot of traveler go in this way, people go slowly with the roundabout. 
And lot of people go to meknes and Fez. ðŸŒ¸ Big place to parc the car. 
We slept in a tente we ask with farmer if itâ€™s possible to put the tent. Better if you speak little bit Arabic ðŸ˜…
As i saw the police bloc after the roundabout i decided to get a lift here. I was really lucky. Got ride to Casablanca after 5 min. Expect to wait more.
Almost to Essaouira. Pretty hard to hitch a car here cause the road is narrow. Nice truck drivers shared food with me. But maybe this is better to get out of the busy Tagazout.
This is probably a spot for you to Zagora if you are to shy to ask for a ride in the nearby gas station. Low traffic and enough time for the driver to decide.
On my way to Zagora, traffic is scarce but you might be able to get a ride pretty quick. Get lift in 2 min. to Tagounite
Got a ride here to Meknes Trans Atlantic hotel after 20 min. waiting and walking and holding a sign..
There is small lockal ''wild'' bus stop where somethimes trucks stop and little before there is small place like a store,but I personally didn't had andy luck there..
When we stood here there was very little traffic but got a ride in 5 minutes from the third car that passed us by all the way to Asni (our destination)
It was very easy finding a ride from here to direction Taliouine

Any spot along this road is good to get easy rides going north-east or south. To go to Ouarzazate, you know there are two roads, this one going north and the second one turning left at the main roundabout of Machraa El, but talking with people, they told us most people take this one road going north.
we (3px) got a ride after 20 minutes, it should be very easy, plus it's near the gare routiere (eventually you can bargain a bus ticket to Ouarzazate for about 100 dh)

To go south: Find a good spot at the end of the village to catch all the cars going south, all the places are good enough, but not in the center of tamanar, f.e. in front of the police station. We (3px) found a ride after 25 minutes, father and little daughter going to Agadir.
I got a lift from here, all the way down to Mauritania with a Malian driver. Here starts really the road of the desert uses by the Senegalese and the Malians, best tip, try to hitch with them.
At the end of the village Ouelad Jerrar, next to a round about.

Gas station, not so much traffic through this road, but got a lift with some tourists and their private guide tour. Nevertheless you can meet some locals and get shown around and hosted just by chance. Wonderful Morocco :)
Just walk out of the town following the Guelmin signs to get here. There are some trees providing shadow or protection from rain. Not much traffic, but from Guelmin there is more.

South in direction Tizniz, Laayoune. There is a fair amount of traffic and enough space to stop, but be very careful when hitchhiking here, as there is a petrol station shortly after the roundabout and cars sometimes come back to the roundabout on the wrong side of the road (that is, the side you are standing at)

Very good place to hitchhike to Tanger. Got a lift after 20min. There is 2 lines but people dont drive too fast here. A friend of mine brought me there, but I think you can take a bus to the airport to get this place
There's trees here if you need some shade.
Got here with a cab from the city...(just ask the drivers) and hitchhiked to immsouane ! Worked quite good
it's pretty cool spot to get hh !! lot's of cars, u can just use u'r hand and they can lift u !!! Direction To 'Tiflet' & Sometimes To ''khemisset.
lots of traffic and also tourists coming from the desert and going north to imperial cities like meknes and fes
people made me take the bus for free but anyway easy to go down till oued zem and qasbah tedla, u can avoid casablanca and enjoy real countryside!
very desert road but easily doable
going south to atlas mountain, taking local bus for 6 Eurocent u can get out from the city and start to hitch calmly in the streets
even if is very desert road, pretty easy to find a lift

u should go to ouarzazate cause the majority of traffic go that direction (and is very low anyway..) i could do it also going south till foum zguid but its too desert and was impossible reach the real desert at muhamid, take draa valley road
Going east to tinghir desert and various gorges
ok going north till saiydia
The toll is ok, no lots of traffic but nice people and even with diarrhoea i could hitch with no problem till oujda
I made a mistake with the map, it's the second exit on the right which is the spot !

We hitched from here with a friend to join the motorway. It worked in less than 15 min for us ! you should try, and don't forget that european standard in terms of hitchhiking spots are not the same in Morrocco. You can hitch from everywhere !
Or take the bus 70dh (7euros) to Rabat (january 2012)...
If you don't want to pay so much money for taxi from the airport walk here and hitchike. it is a very busy road to Tangier and to the South also.
After a big flyover bridge there is a bus stop where you can hitch to highway A4 (also local \\"hitchhikers\\" here).

dec 2010, that a long walk from the center about 1h30 from the bus station. You can find roundabout before, but I slep in the building near by. You can find a bus to go there as well, but a bus ticket to Tetouan is 13.5 Dhs so ... worth it ?
btw: towards rabat and tanger

Many locals use this spot. A lot of traffic and basically a sure thing, but it took a while for someone to pass by who picked up that foreigner. Maybe you want to check out the other highway ramps of the city.

Just walk next to the street with a plage with your destination on it, there will be a lot of people who wants to pick you up!
a little advise from me: use the plage also before on your way to this point next to the street, maybe you dont need so much time then.
there must be a petrol station next to the highway, you can walk next to these highway, and I standed next to these petrol station with a plate, to Marakesh.
Emty road but first car will take you. No difficulties geting a lift to Laayoune or Dakhla. you have real possibilities to catch someone going  to Noukchott or further.
way to Nador. i did the trip with many cars. some of them asked money

Locals are friendly :)
But it feels a little silly to hitchhike sometimes, because the bus to Essaouira is so very cheap from here... A matter of pennies.
I hitched from here to Sidi Kauki many times, usually waiting 10-20 minutes. People have all been very very nice.

A needlessly long walk out of town but I coincided with the school rush so kept on walking until I was out of their way. Best to get here around 11am when tourists are driving through, locals are very unlikely to stop for foreigners in the desert
I was wary of the speed of traffic further up the road. Not a many cars here but theyâ€™re still heading Tangier way. A kid came by and wagged his finger to help me hail a car, it worked. Thanks mate
Most traffic is heading out of town here. Decent enough space to stop
My favourite hitch yet, a donut truck going all the way to Fes. Didnâ€™t see many tourists out this way. Long stretch for vehicles to see you and stop
We catched the truck that took us through whole mountains all the way to the Oulad Berhil. We were riding on the truck bed. It is beautyful road.
We went from Tizi oussem by walk, there were no cars driving down. 1 car per 2 hours. Beautiful hike though.
Couple of guys picked us and took us to  Imlil. We had sign in latin and arabic.

There are some hitchhikers normally waiting behind the border and. Most of them are organising with the truckers somehow. It's definitely not easy there but you are visible to everyone and with some luck you'll catch some tourists who are going far. (French campers rarely take strangers haha)
Not perfect, because not a lot of cars going south, but it worked at the end.
Found a car in 10 minutes and luckily he was working close to the Tanger med and we could get there to catch a ferry. Tried to hitchhike a ferry but didn't succeed in the end
Work pickup truck
Good spot to Agadir. I really recommend to stay in tangzhout it is beatiful city 30 minutes before Agadir. Bus for approxi 10 MAD to Agadir from tanghzhout
10mins and a kind guy took us to tanger med. he even made a detour for us. I think we were lucky though, because the cars are already quite fast.
Good place to hitchhike towards merzouga
Good place for hitchhike towards merzouga
At the end of the line, directly on the motorway, the cars are going fast, but they see you from long distance
No competitors, low traffic for long distance rides. Monday 5pm, without sign.
Good spot to go to FÃ¨s by the national road or the highway. Accessible by taxi (it's the the limit that red taxis cannot exceed before exiting the city).
Station de service/aire de repos assez frÃ©quentÃ©e. Yâ€™a aussi un rond-point Ã  5 minutes Ã  pied au cas oÃ¹
Good place to hitchhike but we might have been lucky since there isnt a lot of cars here
Got a ride from a guy driving a truck to Ouarzazate, he was pretty nice and stopped so me and my friends could take pictures of the mountains that we drove through.
Maybe I was not lucky!!! Also I was with dust around and under the sun, I got a bus, just 2.5 euros  to Chefchaouen...
Lot of local people to wait. Trucks can ask for money.
Not too many traffic, but had to wait only 15 minutes with a sign Chefchaouen
not so many cars but you will prevail :)

Yep!!! Very Good Spot to get Hitching directly into CHEFCHAOUEN!!! but be careful from white taxi! if u want free ride be little bit patience and wait about 3o Min!! But for good to not lose time just walk forward nad stick ur thumb.
Do not go there this is not the right ping

FERRY LIFT: alright, this is the place where you wanna go if you're looking for a free lift on the ferry. Coming from Tangier, if you get dropped at the passenger terminal roundabout, don't go left, cause that's the passenger terminal and you don't need to do anything there, don't go right where you see the truck sign cause that's just a parking lot I guess, GO STRAIGHT, where it seems like you shouldn't go, but that's where you want to go, walk a couple of kms, you'll get to the place where tru

Im the one who wrote the previous comment. Edit: we had no luck at total, actually I think this spot might be better to fes because some people take the highway from there. I give 5 stars to neutralize my previous rating, but you will need a sign there because not many cars stop at the station
There is a way better spot â€žtotalâ€œ about 1km towards Fes. We had no luck there because there were almost only motorbikes stopping, so we decided to relocate to Total with a taxi for 20drh.

you walk out of the city, then you find a petrol station, you can speak with the drivers their, but they want normaly money, dont pay more then 100 diram to Fes. Otherwise take a plate like me, with FES on it, I dont need more then 20 min.
Perfect spot on paper. Maybe just an unlucky day, waited from 1 to nearly sundown. Bailed and caught a grand taxi to Imsouane instead
Good spot for hitchiking to Agadir. Almost every car is going somewhere in direction to Agadir so you can take a small lift or be lucky and find car to Agadir
Good spot. A belgian couple picked me instantly up. Maybe just luck but cars arenâ€™t fast so not bad conditions at all

We waited here 1,5 hours on the way to Ouarzazate. 4 cars stopped but only one went to Ouarzazate, and another half way. Not mentioning all of them required payment. Eventually, we took a bus which was considerably cheaper (60 MAD).
after walking by the cemetery there\\'s a small centre. head for the petrol stations and after the cross you can hitch. direction is ourzazate.

Seams like a good spot. We (2 Boys) waited directly at the motorway where cars could stop easy. But for 3 hours, no one stopped. There is really not a lot of traffic, so I think you have to be luckyâ€¦
Waiting directly on motorway, got a truck going to Laayoune. Good spot but some cars going very fast of course
Many taxis but possible with some tourists in their rented car
There are pretty much only taxis and tourist busses, who tells you not to hitchhike.
You can ask cars as they buy tickets to board. The ferry director actually got us on for free after we waited for a few hours.
After a great trekking arround the nearby dam. I got directly to Zagora by a nice truck driver. No communication if you dont speak french or arabic.
With a sign Ouarzazate it took me 3h to get from Zagora. There is quite lot of local trafic. I was quite lucky, i got picked up by a cheese van. He was going to Marrakesh.
On my way to Zagora, traffic is scarce but you might be able to get a ride pretty quick. Get lift in 20 min. to next Villiage Ouled Driss.

Not much traffic, but I don't see any better spot to go north-east, we waited for 40 minutes before a car stopped and took us to M'Rirt. Eventually busses going north drive by here, easy to stop them.
A lot of traffic going north to El Kalaa and Beni Mellal, we found a ride after 40 minutes, the guy drove us to El Kalaa and paid for the taxi to Beni Mellal for the two of us px, very nice guy.

Sidi Ouaaziz is not the best town to hitch rides from, we stood by the road at the end of the village, but at midday there wasn't much traffic, so I would say we (3px) were lucky to find this short ride after 30 minutes to get out of town, problem is that we got dropped in the middle of nowhere.

Just after the place where Road from Fes enters to highway to Tanger there is place to stop. Cars are run fast but someone will finally stop if you have big sign. For me it took 1,5 h but direct hitch to tanger med. even police saw me couple of times and do nothing.

There usually are a couple of hitchhikers at the wall next to the city, but I tried there for several hours without much success. There is not much traffic going south and most drivers don't take you if you are not willing to pay. So walking out further helped me as the driver couldn't hope for paying hitchhikers after me anymore. There is a roundabout with space to stop for cars afterwards here (but you can try hitchhiking all the way here). Be careful of a guy living in an improvised hut direc

I got a lift here to Asni after walking out of the old town and hitchhiking on the way at diffferent places for over 3 hours. From the old town you will pass about two roundabouts, after that there are not many more side streets, so you might as well stop there and hitchhike. There is some traffic light on the way as well after which is a better spot, as cars are not fast there.
There are some cars from and to merzouga that can take you ! ;)
Works to Essaoira, Agadir and Imsouane.... !
Too close to algerian border. police investigated on me after having dropped me at the poilice station with a ridicoulous excuse taking me there 3 hrs and obliging me to take local minibus
You can take Bus L22 for a few cent...
You have to walk so much getting out of the town then enjoy the trip to the Ocean
Cars very likely to stop. The problem is that there is not much traffic/movement, so be prepared to wait.

There is a large space where cars can stop even of they are going fast. 
Be carefull it is still highway
We were lucky to stop a car going so far. There is a lot of traffic and taxis. And it is probably better to take one to the end of the city (don't spend more than 50 dirhams, fair price might be 20)

Missed the morning tourist rush. Was expecting to catch a grand taxi to town but got lucky and hailed a caravan as I walked. Wasnâ€™t a prime spot as I kept moving but there are decent places for a car to stop on this road
Thereâ€™s a petrol station here. Long walk out of town to avoid children and scams
eventually got taken to tetouan from here, but was surprisingly difficult in this part of morocco
gave up when the bus came which is like 6dh, so not really worth it
Spot itself not the best, but Moroccans will stop. Two guys were heading to Tetouan, which was great as we were heading to the Blue City.

I waited 1 hour here, I wanted to go to Marrakech 
Someone took me to Ounara

Good spot just not many cars going past. Maybe 15-20 cars in the hour we waited. Could have been because of Ramadan as it was early in the morning. Caught a ride just after police check point going to Guelmim-Oued
I found a boat here to go to the Caribbean. Insane luck. I was on another boat at that time and only hopped onto it in Lanzarote. Not many boats here far better to search in Gibraltar or the Canaries
Not so much traffic. Hassle getting there. Still got no better idea for gettin out of meknes towards rabat.

++
the cars go slow
there are many
good interaction with the drivers 

â€”
many cars go only inside chaoen

After 10mins a kind driver took us 10km outside the city to a better spot.
There's a lot of place to stop, but because it's before road split every car think you're going in other direction

Good spot but only a few cars here. There are a cafe and a gas station. Drivers often only go to Taourirt (which is not far way) so you may have a hard time finding a car that goes to FÃ¨s for example. One of the employee of the gas station was also very rude to us. Otherwise, a good spot.
Low traffic due to road end in Mhamid. After a struggling hike i got a ride directly to the desert. Dont waste your time. Better take a bus from Zagora, Morocco is cheap!!!

Tried to hitchhike from here to Marrakech,but was told to move away by police officers that didn't wanted me to see them taking bribe..
Better try your luck on a gas station towards the west..

Ketama doesn't seem to be a good place to hitch hike in and from, we tried in the morning to get a lift to Chefchaouen, there wasn't much traffic, thought it was easier and better to take a 30 dh bus to Chefchaouen.
Maybe waiting longer we could have got a ride, but we waited for just one hour before a girl offered to pay the taxi to Azrous for the two of us.

This spot is full of local hitchhikers, which are all willing to pay a bit for their ride. I tried for over 5 hours at all points between the police checkpoint and the small street joining later before some french picked me up. As everywhere along this road with some patience you can get very long rides to Mauritania.

Going to Tata u can do it, but the other direction, not either asphalt road is almost impossible, i stayed there 3 days waitng for some tourist but is everythin organized and they dont let u sleep4free/camop in the desert if u dont pay. come back till ouarzazate
very lowe traffic, ive been very lucky but almost desert, take the other motorway entrance also to go east!
HUGE TAXI PARKING - They very hard in business, don't go here, too boring propositions, too expensive price... If you really wan to do business, don't accept more than 30 dihrams for go to Tetouan.

WELCOME TO MOROCCO !
DIRECTION TETOUAN 
I think that's the less bad place of the frontier. Just stop hitchhike when there is taxi 
Sign : "Tetouan / no taxi, shukran (Thanks)"
Waiting : 30-50 min
Speed : 40-50 Km/h
Traffic : 15 cars / min - High

Cars here are heading towards Merzouga, but the nearby police checkpoint must have scared potential lifts off. My previous truck driver stopped for me again out of sight from the gendarmes. As far as I understand now it is illegal for locals to transport tourists unless they are a registered taxi or tour guide, at least in this region. I was uncomfortable when my driver started taking backroads and hiding me in his cab as we passed through towns. I now know he was looking out for himself and I t
Grueling
lot of traffic but noone stopped, busses are quite cheap tho

So... It's 2025 and we tried to hitchhike to Algeciras. This is the place where you usually get a ferry ticket. First we tried to enter the "export access" for trucks which is very close by but even a guy who works there told us that the driver needs the name of the passenger on his ticket so we didn't try more. Later we heard around 3 a few busses would arrive and maybe those we could have asked but in the end we just decided to not wait 3h and bought a ticket. I would have loved to try it some
Maybe unlucky but it seems a bad spot to get out of meknes. Had to walk further out.

Going from north direction Tinghit. Up until this point it the road was very empty but still hitchhikable, taking small distances and a lot of time. From here it seemed like basically no cars going that way. But you can sit in local cafe, talk to locals (this village is not touristy, has very authentic vibes) and try to hitchhike from your chair, maybe you'll be lucky. If not, there is a minibus to Tinghir for 50 DH stopping right on the spot.

Very bad place to hitchhike to Casablanca.
Very little traffic, it's a rural area.

Tryed to get to the paradise valley..... ended up renting a car the other day.... :D  Two cars were passing by in one hour.... one of them wanted lots, lots of money, the other one had people sitting on the roof already..
It sucks, but u should really walk down towards these green marked spots if u try to catch a ride to casa. Its a lot better there. Maybe better with a huge ass sign or something.
Nobody picked me up, the people who stopped wanted money, nobody spoke english or franch so i took a bus.
Bad spot to go to fes. Waited 2 hours and went back to get a bus. Everybody told us fes is to far. Maybe it will be better for you to try the highway route. Also no shadow.
Hitched just after the checkpoint, nobody stopped for some reason. Then an english speaking tour guide stopped and said everyone is scared they will get in trouble. Still, the ride always comes.
